conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container (D or E) it will flow into.
Liquids start flowing from points A (cyan), B (yellow), and C (blue).
The cyan liquid flows down, hits the purple baffle first, and is redirected to the right.
The cyan liquid then hits the grey baffle and is further redirected downward.
The cyan liquid continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom and enters container D.
The yellow liquid flows down, hits the purple baffle first, and is redirected to the right.
The yellow liquid then hits the grey baffle and is further redirected downward.
The yellow liquid continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom and enters container D.
The blue liquid flows down, hits the purple baffle first, and is redirected to the right.
The blue liquid then hits the grey baffle and is further redirected downward.
The blue liquid continues flowing downward until it reaches the bottom and enters container D.
In the key step illustration, all three liquids (cyan, yellow, and blue) follow the same path, hitting the purple and grey baffles in the same sequence and flowing into container D.
All liquids from points A, B, and C will flow into container D.
